subject: New API allow clients to execute a pipeline of commands
commit_message:
New API allow clients to execute a pipeline of commands

Currently, several clients of execute() who wish to execute a pipeline
of commands need to do this using a literal string and specifying
"shell=True" in the invocation of subprocess.Popen(). This change
allows users to construct a pipeline of commands, potentially
including sudo, and execute that entire pipeline without requiring
shell=True.

The new API execute_pipeline() takes a subset of the parameters that
execute() accepts and constructs and executes the pipeline, returning
the stdout, stderr and returncode. Similar to execute() this API will
log some information after sanitizing through strutils.mask_password()
and will return stdout and stderr that have been similarly
sanitized.

Also, similar to execute() this API computes total time and logs it in
the same way that execute() does.

I have also reviewed the package 'sarge' and a very quick assessment
indicates that it isn't as fast as the present implementation and in
the short term, I think an implementation similar to execute() would
be preferable. I'll look to wrap sarge and potentially reimplement
processutils based on it independently.

Test cases have been proposed as well.

subject: Add heartbeat support to kombu
commit_message:
Add heartbeat support to kombu

This change adds heartbeat support for kombu by passing in heartbeat parameter
of default value 60 second and adding a thread(eventlet) that spawns after heartbeat/2
seconds to check for the connection.

This is a critical bug fix for cases where network connections are not reliable.
One of my test scenario had a NAT between nova-compute and the nova-conductor/nova-scheduler.
NAT devices are known to drop idle connections without telling corresponding parties of
the state of the connection. This behavior caused interesting 'hung' operation on nova side.

Here are the details:
Setup:

Nova-Conduct/Scheduler are running on a machine 'P' along with Broker
Nova-compute C is running on a virtual machine local at my workplace behind a NAT.
Both P, C are using Kombu 3.0.16 (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/kombu)

P creates a 'topic' exchange and create a Queue (nova_compute_<id>) which needs acknowledgements.
C waits for the message upon arrival sends an ack back to B.

Scenarios:

Positive:
P and C are connected to B, P publishes messages, C receives it and everything works fine.

Negative:
While C is connected to B,

step-1) I disconnect the 'virtual network' which disconnects the virtual machine C is running on.
So effectively C is not reachable anymore. (This should be similar to unplugging network cable to a machine)

At this point of time, I observed the following on broker machine:

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready and unacked messages =0

step-2) I then publish a message from P on the Q.

Now

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready =0 and unacked messages =1

step-3) I then publish another message from P on the Q.

Now

rabbitmqctl list_connections name state timeout : it shows the connection between the B and C as running, timeout value=0
rabbitmqctl list_queues name messages_ready messages_unacknowledged: shows name and both ready =0 and unacked messages =2

step-4) I plug 'connect' the network for C again but I never see the messages on the C they remain in the unacked state > 8 hrs (I didn't check after that).

Solution:
After the fix, the timeout value in Step-1,2,3 = 60 and step-4 succeeds and the messages are delivered.

Some references:

http://kombu.readthedocs.org/en/latest/reference/kombu.connection.html
https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html
https://github.com/celery/py-amqp/

subject: Implement message flow control using link credit
commit_message:
Implement message flow control using link credit

This change implements a scheme for managing link credit for consumer
links.  There are two different link use cases in this driver, each
of which employs its own credit management scheme:

The per-connection RPC reply link: the RPC sender is rate limited
given the synchronous nature of the RPC implementation.  Also, we need
to avoid having a 'slow' RPC client block an RPC server. Therefore the
shared RPC reply link does not backpressure senders.  It maintains a
credit level in the range of [$reply_credit/2 ... $reply_credit].

The per-target RPC server links: the RPC servers need to be able to
backpressure the broker should the server's backlog of incoming RPC
request messages becomes 'excessive'.  This is done by implementing a
high/low watermark on the queue of incoming RPC request messages.
When the number of queued RPC request messages becomes greater than
$listener_max_backlog, the driver will stop granting credit on all
receive links associated with the RPC server's subscription to its
target.  When the number of queued RPC requests drops to less than
$listener_low_backlog, credit will resume being granted to the receive
links.  The scheme for maintaining credit on the topic's receive links
(when not blocking) is similar to the method used for the
per-connection RPC reply link: the credit level on all links is
maintained in the range [$subscription_credit/2
... $subscription_credit].

Change-Id: If2a00139123d069d6968d6451d974d8aa183dcc4
Closes-Bug: #1367911

subject: Allow parsing of key/value lines with leading whitespace
commit_message:
Allow parsing of key/value lines with leading whitespace

Removing a hash from a line in a config file without also removing
the leading space on the line leads to a parsing error.  The
problem occurs because any line starting with a space is assumed
to be the second parameter in a 'multiline' key/value assignment.

The proposed fix allows for the multiline assignment and allows
any line to have leading whitespace by requiring than any
additional lines in a multiline assignment do not have colons or
equals signs.  If a line does have a colon or equals sign, it's
considered a new key/value assignment.

If and when configuration files are more standardized, this
parsing behavior should be revisited.  At this point, though, it
fixes the reported bug and passes all the other parsing tests as
well.

Currently Neutron server spawns two green threads for api and rpc

subject: Prevent a UnicodeDecodeError in the s3token middleware
commit_message:
Prevent a UnicodeDecodeError in the s3token middleware

Mixing "str" and "unicode" can lead to a UnicodeDecodeError. We encode unicode
values before using them with text strings.

The bug occurs if the URL contains a non-ASCII character in the tenant id:
"hého" in "/v1/AUTH_cfa/c/hého" ("/v1/AUTH_cfa/c/h\xc3\xa9ho" in UTF-8) for
example.

The bug occurs on Python 2 in s3_token.py because the tenant id is retrieved
from identity_info['access']['token']['tenant'] and identity_info comes from
resp.json().

The problem is that in Python, the JSON decoder always create Unicode strings.
Example in Python 2:

>>> json.loads('{"key": "value"}') {u'key': u'value'}

There is no issue in Python 3, since all text strings are Unicode.

Closes-Bug: #1428706

commit_message:
Port Removal handling

Only handles events generated from ovs itself. Future patches will
handle events generated from Neutron

Port removal is designed to be agnostic to the purpose of the flows.
It uses a Bloom Filter [1] to select the flows to be removed. We can
handle mismatches since if valid flow was removed it will be recreated
by the controller on next packet.This puts the responsibility of marking
the flow on the flow creator.
When creating a flow, it's important that the cookie contain a filter
built from all the ports that need to exist for the flow to remain
active.To create a proper filter one should use the provided
CookieFilter()
class. Specifically CookieFilter.from_route([port1, port2, ...]).The
values used are the values returned from PortData.cookie_hash.

subject: Abstract 'mkdir' shell commands in guestagent
commit_message:
Abstract 'mkdir' shell commands in guestagent

The guestagent commonly executes basic shell commands
such as 'mkdir' across multiple files and datastores.
Each datastore currently scripts its own shell calls.
Apart from cluttering the Python code with shell constructs,
it also makes maintenance of the shell calls more difficult by
requiring the same change be made across multiple lines,
source files and/or potentially even datastores.

The goal of this patch set is to provide a simple straightforward
interface for most common shell calls used across the guestagent
code while encapsulating the related shell code into a single module.

This patch set includes refactoring of 'mkdir' and related 'chown'
calls.
It also introduces unit tests ('guestagent/test_operating_system')
for the above implementations.

The shell code was moved into 'common/operating_system' module.
The replacing interface is:

def create_directory(dir_path, user=None, group=None, force=True):
    """Create a given directory and update its ownership
    (recursively) to the given user and group if any."""

The existing interface for 'chown' has been extended to maintain
consistency with 'mkdir'.

def chown(path, user, group, recursive=True, force=False):
    """Changes the owner and group of a given file.
    """

The calls also take optional keyword arguments:
    :param as_root:          Execute as root.
    :type as_root:           boolean

    :param timeout:          Number of seconds if specified,
                             default if not.
                             There is no timeout if set to None.
    :type timeout:           integer

Most occurrences of the above two shell calls ('mkdir' and 'chown')
in the guestagent code have been replaced by the above abstraction.
I did not replace native Python os.chown() and os.mkdir() calls
and calls that are executed as a part of a larger shell script
in this patch set.

Authored-By: Petr Malik <pmalik@tesora.com>
Change-Id: I0fe96301087e3bd49d937c7c489006fd9d84ca1e
Depends-On: Ib969a111d102b817c9f18437c1f36bd17e3a8a4b
Closes-Bug: 1431618

subject: Set loading strategy to joined for Routerport/Port
commit_message:
Set loading strategy to joined for Routerport/Port

The RouterPort model has a relationship to the ports model which
is frequently relied on to get the port IDs of interfaces attached
to a router. However, this defaults to the loading strategy to
'select', which meant a new query was being emitted for every
interface to the ports table just to get the ID.

This patch adjusts the relationship to be 'joined' by default so
one query will fetch the related ports.

Another option would have been not to use the port object at all since
the ID is all that the callers were usually interested in. However,
they would end up using the ID to do a port lookup, which is being
optimized away in another patch anyway so the full port object from
the relationship will end up getting used.

Change-Id: Id1ae35f845f7367d5f1f065c6fa637da7b980a2b
Partial-Bug: #1445412
(cherry picked from commit 10b17a884452736a6b214bcb7705b955192a1748)

Don't update port with host id of None

subject: Spawn RADVD only in the master HA router
commit_message:
Spawn RADVD only in the master HA router

Currently radvd is spawned in all the HA routers irrespective of the
state of the router. This approach has the following issues.

1. While processing the internal router ports (i.e., qr-xxx), ha_router
   removes the LLA of the interface and adds it as a VIP to Keepalived conf.
   Radvd daemon is spawned after this operation in the router namespace
   (if the port is associated with any IPv6 subnets). Radvd notices that
   qr-xxx interface does not have the LLA, so does not transmit any Router
   Advts. In this state, VMs fail to acquire IPv6 addresses because of the
   missing RAs. Radvd does not recover even after keepalived configures the
   LLA of the interface. The only solution is to restart/reload radvd daemon.
   Currently keepalived-state-change monitor does not do any radvd related
   operations when a state transition happens. So we endup in this state
   forever.
2. For all the routers in Backup state, qr-xxx interface does not have LLA
   as it is managed by keepalived and configured only on the Master HA router.
   In such agents syslog is flooded with the messages [1] and this can cause
   loss of other useful info.
   [1] - resetting ipv6-allrouters membership on qr-2e373555-97

This patch implements the following.
1. If the router is already in the Master state, we configure the LLA as a VIP
   in keepalived conf but do not delete the LLA of the internal interface.
2. We spawn radvd only if the router is in the Master State.
3. Keepalived-state-change monitor takes care of enabling/disabling radvd upon
   state transitions.

Closes-Bug: #1440699
Change-Id: I351c71d058170265bbb8b56e1f7a3430bd8828d5

subject: Add VLAN to network meta if applicable
commit_message:
Add VLAN to network meta if applicable

Certain compute drivers need to determine the VLAN for a VIF at plug
time.  This need can be seen by the existing VMware driver and others
that separate out VIF logic based on Neutron or Nova network.  This
goes against the purpose of the nova network API abstraction, which is
meant to hide if the admin is using Neutron or Nova backed networks.

This change set provides the VLAN to be included (if applicable) on the
VIF's network object (meta section).  It is not included if the
network's type is not VLAN.  This change supports both nova network
and neutron networks.

By putting this metadata in the VIF's network object, it avoids the
issue where certain drivers are:
 - Detecting which network is being used
 - Invoking specific operations against that network client to gather
   the needed data

This change does not update the drivers themselves, but rather lays the
foundation so that these drivers can take advantage of it.  Subsequent
change sets are required for platform driver utilization.

Change-Id: I6187428caa04d8a7fd878c7d7ff11fd84c656cab
